title: Antic Teatre
address: Carrer de Verdaguer i Callís, 12, 08003 Barcelona
summary: Cute theatre hidden in a bar, didn't understand a thing but it was a lot of fun.

title: Wine & Cava Tasting Experience
summary: Sip and swirl your way through Catalonia's famous wine, visiting 3 renowned estates to sample bold reds, crisp whites and sparkling cava. Learn about the area's rich viticultural heritage as you pair each varietal with regional cheeses and traditional appetisers.

title: Picasso Museum
summary: The Museo Picasso houses one of the most extensive collections of artworks by the 20th-century Spanish artist Pablo Picasso. With 4,251 works exhibited by the painter, the museum has one of the most complete permanent collections of works.  Highlights of the collection include two of his first major works, The First Communion (1896), and Science and Charity (1897). In particular, the Museu Picasso reveals Picasso's relationship with the city of Barcelona, a relationship that was shaped in his youth and adolescence and continued until his death.  An unmissible event for anyone visiting this beautiful and extraordinary city.

itinerary_title: Family Fun at Costa Dorada PortAventura Theme Park
title: Port Aventura Theme Park
address: Avinguda del Batlle Pere Molas, km 2, 43840 Vila-seca, Tarragona
summary: Long lines, but we paid for the speedy line tickets which were expensive but worth it. My kids had an absolute ball, and it's a good day trip for all family members of all ages to enjoy. Would definitely come again.

title: Palau Guell
summary: Palau Guell is a great place to start. Situated near the base of the Rambla in the Raval neighborhood, PG offers a sumptuous glimpse into Gaudi's early years.

title: Placa d'Espanya Train Station
summary: Start your journey at PI. Espanya, (enter via Creu Coberta as there are a lot of entrances and exits). You will want to start your day quite early so you can fully enjoy the journey. Catch the R5 FGC train to Manresa-Baixador, and after 22 stops, get off at MONISTROL DE MONTSERRAT. The train takes approximately 1.5 hours, and you get to enjoy the view of outer cities of Barcelona along the way.

title: Shop down Passeig de Gracia
address: Passeig de Gracia, Dreta de L'Eixample
summary: Great if you need a new watch, or bag. You can look at the Gaudi buildings too.

title: El Cap de Barcelona
summary: El Cap de Barcelona is a surrealist sculpture created by American Pop artist Roy Lichtenstein for the 1992 Summer Olympics.

title: Museo del Fútbol Club Barcelona
summary: I took myself and my two kids for the Players Experience tour which has exclusive features like visiting the players changing rooms. It was my little boys birthday so we went all out. Would really recommend it, we got to walk along the pitch and the tour guide was very informative. The museum was also good.

title: Virreina Square
summary: Pretty Square

title: Kikibio Restaurant
summary: Carrer de Blai is filled with Pincho bars, so me and my friends normally spend a day walking through it, stopping at different bars and getting a beer and a pincho and having a chat. The bars I've listed is just a few, there are loads more so feel free to pick your own. Some are more expensive than others, i've tried to pick the cheapest. Perfect day for a student saving money.

title: Picasso Museum
summary: The Museo Picasso houses one of the most extensive collections of artworks by the 20th-century Spanish artist Pablo Picasso. With 4,251 works exhibited by the painter, the museum has one of the most complete permanent collections of works.  Highlights of the collection include two of his first major works, The First Communion (1896), and Science and Charity (1897). In particular, the Museu Picasso reveals Picasso's relationship with the city of Barcelona, a relationship that was shaped in his youth and adolescence and continued until his death.

title: Mood Rooftop Bar
summary: Poached eggs are delicious, started the tour off with a simosa.

title: Bus Journey to Tossa de Mar
address: Estacio del Nord Carrer d'Alí Bei, 80, 08013 Barcelona
summary: Take the coach to Tossa de Mar, the journey lasts aprox 1hr 45minutes.

title: Can Sophia
address: Carrer de la Roqueta, 10, 17320 Tossa de Mar, Girona
summary: Good breakfast

title: Train to Sitges
address: You can catch the train from three central stations in Barcelona: Estacio de Francia Passeig de Gracia Sants Estacio
summary: The train takes approximately 40 minutes, and you can enjoy the rustic, graffitti covered buildings on your way out the city.

title: Breakfast at Red Velvet Cafe
address: Passeig de la Ribera, 8, 08870 Sitges, Barcelona
summary: Very cosy with nice breakfasts, lovely start to the day.

title: Brandenburg Gate
summary: Enjoy one of the most historical landmarks and touristic hubs of Berlin.

title: Berlin Wall East Gallery
summary: We walked along the whole east gallery of the Berlin wall where projects were commissioned by 118 artists to celebrate its demise.

title: NEMO Science Museum
summary: The museum is HUGE and looks like a giant ship. It has interactive science exhibits and experiments. It was a family holiday, and the kids thoroughly enjoyed playing with all the different displays. We stopped for a snack and a coffee in the museum cafe.

title: The Oude Church
summary: This ancient church is steeped in history and has stood in Amsterdam for over 800 years. Today, the church acts as a cultural centre and regularly hosts exhibitions and concerts.

title: The Oude Church
summary: This ancient church is steeped in history and has stood in Amsterdam for over 800 years. Today, the church acts as a cultural centre and regularly hosts exhibitions and concerts.

title: Scandinavian Embassy Cafe for Breakfast
summary: Scandinavian style breakfast in a unique venue.

title: Belém Tower
summary: Landmark

itinerary_title: A short time with Lisbon wine
title: Lisbon Wine Tasting Private Tour
summary: Private tour guide and private tastings, learn about the culture, and wine and dine at some of the best vineyards in Lisbon. It was an absolute pleasure undergoing this delectable adventure and I could not recommend it more highly.

title: Eiffel Tower
address: Champ de Mars, 5 Avenue Anatole France, 75007 Paris, France
summary: Gustave Eiffel's iconic, wrought-iron 1889 tower, with steps and elevators to observation decks.

itinerary_title: Paris without wine is not fine.
title: Eiffel Tower
address: Champ de Mars, 5 Avenue Anatole France, 75007 Paris, France
summary: Perfect introduction to Paris, the Eiffel Tower is simply a must.

title: The Long Hall Pub
address: 51 South Great George's Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
summary: So tacky but great drinks

title: Hungarian National Gallery
summary: Take your time to enjoy the splender of the exquisite art exhibitions from permanent to temporary collections, of Hungarian works from the 15th century to the modern day.   Stop at the gallery cafe or one of the outside stalls and have a coffee and a cake and take in the stunning views from high up on the beautiful Buda Castle hill.  A truely incomparable site behond imagination.

title: Shoes on the Danube Bank
address: Budapest, Id. Antall József rkp., 1054 Hungary
summary: Waterside shoe sculptures memorializing those killed at the river by a fascist party during WWII.

title: Tokaj Wine Country Day Trip outside Budapest
summary: Taste the sweet side of Hungary’s wine region on a full-day tour of Tokaj from Budapest. Led by a local guide, you'll travel through the scenic countryside famous for its dessert wine. Your trip includes stops at three wineries to taste the unique varietals of each. Listen in on the winemakers’ best secrets and take a tour of a local cellar and vineyard. You’ll also be treated to a delicious 3-course lunch, along with meat and cheese samples at the third and final winery. A day to remember and savour, just thinking about it makes my mind shiver with delight at the distinctive and yummy flavours we had the pleasure of tasting. Yum!

title: Roaming the Streets
address: Old Town Staré Město 110 00 Prague 1 Czechia
summary: Prague has some of the most intricate and beautiful architecture I’ve ever seen.

title: Santiago Bernabéu Stadium
summary: I took myself to my first Real Madrid Match and it was phenomenal. No kids today but I know they would have loved it.

title: Museo Nacional del Prado
summary: I had a very enjoyable time at the Museo Nacional del Prado. Very informative and filled with beautiiful exhibits. Would highly recommend it, the art was just stunning.

title: Vatican Museums
summary: Multiple galleries plus the Sistine Chapel frescoes, pretty interesting.

title: Colosseum
address: Piazza del Colosseo, 1, 00184 Roma RM, Italy

title: Villa Farnesina
address: Via della Lungara, 230, 00165 Roma RM, Italy
summary: Villa Farnesina is a suburban Renaissance villa that is probably the most underrated museum in all of Rome. It was built for Agostino Chigi, the treasurer of Pope Julius II, who commissioned Raphael (among others) to paint elaborate frescoes in the airy space.   Raphael’s 16th century frescoes of Cupid and Psyche and the Triumph of Galatea adorn the ceiling of the loggia, or ground floor of the palazzo, and are the best known works in the villa.

title: Bernini’s Apollo and Daphne
address: Borghese Gallery and Museum Piazzale Scipione Borghese, 5, 00197 Roma RM, Italy
summary: This statue will make you rethink what is humanly possible for an art genius to create. This life-sized marble statue residing within Galleria Borghese portrays Apollo clutching Daphne as she tries to escape him, precisely in the moment that her father begins her transformation into a laurel tree to save her from his grasp. Her fingers transforming into leaves are breathtakingly beautiful and demonstrate Bernini’s talent in spite of his young age.

title: Antic Teatre
address: Carrer de Verdaguer i Callís, 12, 08003 Barcelona
summary: The beer garden after the show is really nice and filled with people, hard to find a table but I had a lot of fun.

title: Walk through the Gothic Quarter
address: The Gothic Quarter Barri Gotic Barcelona
summary: As you walk out of El Borne from the Picasso Museum and slowly make your way through the rustic streets of the Gothic quarter, you feel the history resonating from it's narrow lanes.  This quarter encompasses the oldest parts of the city of Barcelona, and includes the remains of the city's Roman wall and several notable medieval landmarks. Much of the present-day fabric of the quarter, however, dates to the 19th and early 20th centuries.

title: Casa Battlo
summary: Make your way through the labyrinth of Gotico to Passeig de Gracia, a grand boulevard home to two of Gaudi's most iconic structures. Start here, with Casa Battlo, a radiant turquoise marvel whose undulant curves suggest the rippling currents of the sea.

title: Montserrat Hike
address: Monistrol de Montserrat Train Station, 18, Carrer Pont, 18, 08691, Barcelona
summary: Once you arrive to Monistrol de Montserrat train station, you have to find the beginning of the trail before making your way up the mountain. It takes aproximately 15 minutes and there are guided signs to lead the way.  Once you make it to the track, it's a steady incline on a rocky terrain with some random stairs all the way to the top. There are red, white and green painted markers all the way up to the monastery, and various forks in the path you can take. I would recommend following the Cami de les Aigues (GR 5) trail, it veers slightly to the left and is the easiest option. It takes you 10 minutes longer to get to the top and ascends less quickly, but has a wider and easier path.  The hike takes between an hour and a half to two hours depending on how fast a hiker you are and which paths you choose to take.

title: Sangria on rooftop bar 'La Dolce Vitae' on Hotel Majestic
Parc de la Cuitadella/ Arc de Triomph
summary: The Parc de la Ciutadella is beautiful and contains the city's zoo, the Palau del Parlament de Catalunya, a small lake, museums and a large fountain designed by Josep Fontserè. Climb towards the Arc de Triomphe, the triumphal arch of the city. It was built, by the architect Josep Vilaseca i Casanovas, as the main access door for the 1888 Barcelona World Fair. After this, go through El Borne and pay attention to the various parts of street art that are they scatter through the streets.

title: Lunch at Taller Tapas
summary: Nice tapas, staff were great with the kids, especially when they found out it was my sons birthday.

title: Bades
address: Carrer de Blai, 57, 08004 Barcelona, Spain, 08004 Barcelona
summary: 1 Beer, 1 Pincho

title: Walk through the Gothic Quarter
address: The Gothic Quarter Barri Gotic Barcelona
summary: As you walk out of El Borne from the Picasso Museum and slowly make your way through the rustic streets of the Gothic quarter, you feel the history resonating from it's narrow lanes.  This quarter encompasses the oldest parts of the city of Barcelona, and includes the remains of the city's Roman wall and several notable medieval landmarks. Much of the present-day fabric of the quarter, however, dates to the 19th and early 20th centuries.

title: Hotel Condes
summary: Nice cocktails

title: Beach!
address: Avenida de Sant Ramon de Penyafort, Carrer Sant Ramon de Penyafort, 17320 Tossa de Mar, Girona
summary: Relax, draw, swim, read a book, sun bathe, enjoy!

title: Castell de Tossa
address: Passeig de Vila Vella, 1, 17320 Tossa de Mar, Girona
summary: Walk around the old town, climb up to castell de Tossa, enjoy all the historical landmarks for free.

title: Museu de Maricel
summary: A superb collection of art, an utter surprise and delight and a very reasonable price!

title: Church of Parròquia de Sant Bartomeu i Santa Tecla
summary: Very picturesc church with lovely old organ and some nice side chapels.

title: Brandenburg Gate Museum
summary: The Brandenburg Gate Museum is a multimedia history museum with a panoramic wall. Very interesting and worth a visit.

title: The Wall Museum
summary: Worth a visit after walking along the East Side Gallery, it helped us understand the gravity of the situation and is really eye opening to the history.

title: Restaurant 212
summary: Affordable and extremely tasty menu from former michelin star chef of Bord'eau. I was worried it would be a bit fancy to bring the kids, but actually it was quite casual and the staff were very patient and considerate.

title: Amsterdam's 17th Century Canal Belt
summary: Amsterdam’s 17th-century canal belt curves around its city centre and is within easy walking distance from de Oude Kerk.

title: Amsterdam's 17th Century Canal Belt
summary: Amsterdam’s 17th-century canal belt curves around its city centre and is within easy walking distance from de Oude Kerk.

title: Van Gogh Museum
summary: Museum housing the world's largest collection of Van Gogh paintings, alongside drawings & letters.

title: Vela Latina for Lunch
address: Doca do Bom Sucesso, 1400-038 Lisboa, Portugal

title: Lunch at Constant Cafe
summary: Cosy, casual restaurant with great coffee.

title: Lunch at Le Fumoir
address: 6 Rue de l'Amiral de Coligny, 75001 Paris, France

itinerary_title: Paris without wine is not fine.
title: Carmine Café
summary: Expensive yet superb, the burgers are huge, the wine is exquisite, which one can only expect, and you have a lovely view of the Park Champ de Mars.

title: Fade Street Social Restaurant
address: 4 Fade St, Dublin 2, D02 NF77, Ireland
summary: Yummy food

title: San Lorenzo’s Italian Restaurant
address: 9, Castle House, 73-83 South Great George's Street, Dublin 2, Ireland

title: Hungarian Parliament Building
summary: Landmark Gothic Revival–style edifice with lavishly decorated rooms, plus a visitors' center.

title: Medievil Tavern
summary: So cool, feels like you're stepping into another time.

title: Eating a Trdelnik
address: U Starého hřbitova 42/2, 110 00 Josefov-Staré Město, Czechia
summary: Don’t ask me to pronounce it, but this dessert was amazing! Dough, shaped into a cylinder, rolled in cinnamon sugar, baked over a flame, then filled with ice cream.

title: Santiago Bernabéu Stadium
summary: I waited outside to see if I could get my kids some autographs but no chance.

title: Laveronica for Lunch
summary: Yummy food and wine and had a really nice cake with a coffee afterwards. Such a ittle treat, and I don't mean the dessert!

title: Caffè Vaticano
address: viale, Viale Vaticano, 100, 00192 Roma RM, Italy
summary: Awesome coffee, totally recommend the carrot cake.

title: Basilica Santi Giovanni e Paolo
address: Piazza Dei SS. Giovanni e Paolo, 00184 Roma RM, Italy

title: Il Fico Ristorante Pizzeria
address: Via di Monte Giordano, 49, 00186 Roma RM, Italy
summary: Traditional, rustic trattoria serving Roman pizza & pasta, plus hearty meat & seafood dishes.

title: Larys Restaurant
summary: Superb wine and quaint outdoor seating area. A very agreeable meal.

title: Lunch at Els Quatre Gats
summary: Take your time to feel the weight of this historical treasure, you are walking on the same floors that many historical art figures once walked. The cafe became a famously popular meeting place for famous artists throughout the modernist period in Catalonia, known as Modernisme. The café opened on June 12, 1897 in the famous Casa Martí, and served as a hostel, bar and cabaret until it eventually became a central meeting point for Barcelona’s most prominent modernist figures, such as Pablo Picasso and Ramon Casas i Carbó.

title: Casa Mila "La Pedrera"
summary: Right up the street is La Pedrera. It's worth it to spend a little extra time here to explore the Gaudi Museum and period apartment simulacrum. The roof, with its cubist chimneys and paths that dip and pivot vertiginously, is a true wonder.

title: Restaurant Hostal Abat Cisneros
address: Monasterio de Montserrat, Plaza del Monasterio, s/n, 08199 Montserrat, Barcelona
price: Set lunch (VAT not included): approx. 27,50 € Average price of à la carte lunch or dinner: approx. 35,00 € From 12:30 pm to 3:30 pm
summary: Restaurant Hostal Abat Cisneros offers a set menu, 3 course meal. The ceiling in the dinning room is made of stone, and was used as a stable in the16th century. It's tranquil and rustic, the perfect setting to recuperate and eat some food. I would reccomend booking in advance just in case.

title: Carry on shopping down Passeig de Gracia
address: Passeig de Gracia, Dreta de L'Eixample
summary: I got a new suit at Bel y Cia.

title: The Pans Club for Lunch
summary: Large quiches, simple and healthy food. Leave El Borne and cross the Gothic quarter in the direction of the Cathedral of Barcelona and get lost in the streets and try to find the hidden gems of graffiti.

title: Camp Nou Football Match
summary: Had a fantastic time! The kids loved it, and so did I. Worth spending a little extra to see the smile on both my kids faces. An experience of a lifetime.

title: Plaça del Sol
summary: Food is super cheap, the only reason it's so expensive is because we stayed and kept ordering canyas (beers) :L Really cool square, people come and sit with their own beers and chill in the sun. Super Guay!

title: Restaurante Blai 56
summary: 1 Beer, 1 Pincho

title: Lunch at Els Quatre Gats
summary: Take your time to feel the weight of this historical treasure, you are walking on the same floors that many historical art figures once walked. The cafe became a famously popular meeting place for famous artists throughout the modernist period in Catalonia, known as Modernisme. The café opened on June 12, 1897 in the famous Casa Martí, and served as a hostel, bar and cabaret until it eventually became a central meeting point for Barcelona’s most prominent modernist figures, such as Pablo Picasso and Ramon Casas i Carbó.

title: La Dolce Vitae
summary: Great Sangria

title: Restaurant Victoria Bar
address: Passeig del Mar, 23, 17320 Tossa de Mar, Girona
summary: Enjoy a Paella and a beer.

title: Restaurante Castell Vell
address: Plaça del Pintor Roig i Soler, 17320 Tossa de Mar, Girona
summary: Really nice lunch, traditional mediterranean restaurant.

title: Fragata for Lunch
address: Passeig de la Ribera, 1, 08870 Sitges, Barcelona
summary: Gorgeous Catalan and Mediterranean food, fabulous wine, would definitely recommend it!

title: Racó de la Calma
summary: The architecture around the old town of Sitges is so refreshing, I loved losing myself down the little quaint streets.

title: Quarré
summary: Nice restaurant, has a great view of the Brandenburg Gate while you eat.

title: Seoul Kitchen BBQ Restaurant
summary: Korean food, we both loved the fact the meat was cooked right infront of us.

title: Gartine for Lunch
summary: Antique-filled cafe for lunch, pretty tasty.

title: Gartine for Lunch
summary: Antique-filled cafe for lunch, pretty tasty.

title: Vondelpark
summary: Expansive, 19th-century urban park with a playground, ponds & an open-air theater.

itinerary_title: Paris without wine is not fine.
title: Bus to Le Marais
summary: Aprox 45 minutes to Le Marais Hotel on bus number 69. Every ten minutes or so.

title: Capitol Lounge
address: 1 Aungier St, Dublin 2, D02 HF72, Ireland
summary: Good cocktails and cute Irish guys, perfect for after dinner ;)

title: The Stag's Head
address: 1 Dame Ct, Dublin, D02 TW84, Ireland
summary: Absolute class pub!

title: Iguana Bar & Grill
summary: Enchiladas, burritos & tequila menu in high-ceilinged restaurant, with colourful Mexican poster art.

title: Walking across the Charles Bridge
summary: Constructed around the 15th century, the Charles Bridge is a historic bridge crossing the Vltava river.

title: KM de Pizza
summary: Very good pizza, a little overpriced but probably because of how close it is to the stadium.

title: Caravaggio’s Paintings in the Contarelli Chapel
address: Church of St. Louis of the French Piazza di S. Luigi de' Francesi, 00186 Roma RM, Italy
summary: Caravaggio is one of the most celebrated Baroque painters in Italian history; he was a radical innovator that painted dramatic scenes and expertly employed the chiaroscuro technique, strongly contrasting light and dark to create multidimensional works of art with a strong base in naturalism.

title: Park Villa Borghese
address: Piazzale Napoleone I, 00197 Roma RM, Italy
summary: Take a stroll around this exquisite site, filled with stunning pieces, free to peruse and admire whilst enjoying nature at it's finest.

title: La Pepita
summary: Lunchtime! Skip the overpriced tourist traps and head across Diagonal to La Pepita, small hip gem in the Gracia neighborhood. The midday menu is a steal for 11€, and, if you're feeling adventurous, order the morcilla, a Spanish blood sausage.

title: The Benedictine Abbey and the Basilica / Santa Cova Chapel
summary: After replenishing yourself, drink in the panaromic views and take advantage of the holy artifacts located around the mountain.  Located inside of the monastery is a statue of the of the Virgin of Montserrat, one of the few black madonnas of Europe. If you want to see Santa Cova Chapel, give yourself an extra hour of walking time.  (From the monastery, take the Santa Cova funicular down to the walking trail. Follow the trail along the mountain cliffs to the chapel.) The Holy Cave of Montserrat once housed the Virgin of Montserrat. Three hundred years ago a chapel was built on this spot as commemoration.

title: Mazah Lebanese Restaurant
address: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 618, Barcelona

title: The Kiss of Freedom/ Barcelona Cathedral
address: Carrer dels Capellans, 16, 08002 Barcelona Pla de la Seu, s/n, 08002 Barcelona
summary: As you approach The Kiss of Freedom, you realise that it is actually a mosaic made up of thousands of small ceramic tiles. Each individual record has a printed photo of a person, a place, a moment, an event or something that in some way represents an expression of freedom. The Cathedral of Santa Cruz and Santa Eulalia, also known as the Cathedral of Barcelona, ​​is the Gothic cathedral and headquarters of the Archbishopric of Barcelona, ​​Spain. The cathedral was built from the 13th to the 15th century.

title: Wait for Autographs
summary: We couldn't leave without tryinng to get autographs from the players. My boys were so excited to see Messi, but unfortunately we didn't get them. But I would still recommend waiting just in case, my boys were so excited waiting in the crowd with everyone else to see the players.

title: Vila de Gràcia Square
summary: Adorable kids with their families running around everywhere and playing

title: Malamen
summary: 1 Beer, 1 Pincho

title: Barcelona Museum of Contemporary Art Museu d'Art Contemporani de Barcelona
summary: From Modern to Contempory, you can feel the shift of paradigms as you lose yourself in another world of artistic expressionism. In 1959, art critic Alexandre Cirici Pellicer formed a group of contemporary artists showing work in a series of 23 exhibitions with the hopes of beginning a collection for a new contemporary art museum in Barcelona. It was not until 1986 that the Barcelona City Council recommended the American architect Richard Meier & Partners (1987–1995) to design the museum.

title: Hotel Pulitzer
summary: Great gin, comes with homemade crisps to snack on

title: Stand up paddle board
address: Activa T Ocio, Tossa de Mar, Girona
summary: If you're lucky, the tour takes you into the caves and all around Tossa de Mar, really cool and beautiful.

title: Museu del Far
address: Passeig de Vila Vella, s/n, 17320 Tossa de Mar, Girona
summary: Cheap entry, a little historical art axhibition from local artists.

title: Pink Triangle
summary: Sitges has a large Gay population both permanent and visitors. This cute Pink Triangle monument acts as a reminder against homophobia, something we should all workk together to fight. Definitely worth a peruse.

title: Platja de Sant Sebatia
address: Carrer de Port Alegre, 45, 08870 Sitges, Barcelona
summary: This beach is very charming, can be a bit crowded at times but I thoroughly enjoyed sunbathing, dipping my toes in the sea and reading my book.

title: Zoo ARTIS
summary: Zoo park founded in 19th century, with chimps, zebras & elephants, plus aquarium & planetarium.

title: Groot Melkhuis for Lunch.
summary: Chalet-style, waterside cafe in the park serving snacks & drinks, plus a terrace & kids' playground.

itinerary_title: Paris without wine is not fine.
title: Marais District Food Walking Tour with Wine and Cheese Tastings
summary: You meet your tour guide and small group in the center of the Le Marais district. Discover about the artisanal French cuisine and culinary specialties that make this historic area a fascinating and delicious place to explore. Bon Apetite!

title: Visiting Old Town Square
summary: While very touristy, the Old Town Square is not to be missed. The square features the Prague Orloj, the oldest astronomical clock in the world still in operation!

title: Galleria Doria Pamphilj
address: Via del Corso, 305, 00186 Roma RM, Italy
summary: The opulent Gallery of Mirrors lies within the Renaissance Palazzo Doria Pamphilj and features 18th century frescoes, gilded mirrors and dozens of marble statues. The gallery resembles a miniature Versailles but without the crowds.

title: National Gallery of Modern and Contemporary Art
address: Viale delle Belle Arti, 131, 00197 Roma RM, Italy
summary: A renowned collection of 19th- & 20th-century art, including work by Canova, Modigliani & Van Gogh, you simply cannot miss this national treasure whilst in Rome.  Take the time to breathe in the beauty, it is truely is spectacular.

title: Sagrada Familia
summary: Fortified by lunch and Spanish wine, it's time to tackle Gaudi's masterwork. Make sure to book your tickets ahead of time, as it sells out daily, and while some don't feel the towers are worth the extra cost, do you really want to come to Barcelona and then skimp on one of the world's greatest architectural marvels?

title: Montserrat Return Hike
summary: You can either retrace your steps, or choose a different path all the way back to Monistrol de Montserrat train station. If you're too tired there are different return routes back down the mountain such as another train ride or the funicular which is also a very popular alternative.

title: Private Ferrari Experience
address: Pick up Point: Passeig de Joan de Borbó 86, Barcelona

title: La Boqueria
summary: Take a look at the largest market in Barcelona, ​​a great tourist spot, and a great place to have a smoothie.

title: Can Fusté Restaurante
address: Gran Via de Carles III, 52, 08028 Barcelona
summary: Really busy! If my boys hadnt been so hungry and exhausted I definitely would have just left. After the game there were so many people it was hard to get served quickly. The boys were falling asleep standing up by the time we got a table. But food and staff were nice, I recommend booking beforehand.

title: Bobby Gin Bar
summary: 'God Save the Gin!' - Best slogan ever created, ever.

title: Viandbeers
summary: 1 Beer, 1 Pincho

title: Dos Pebrots
summary: Tasty and unique tapas, very close to the museum, and the perfect place to digest all the beautiful pieces you have just had the pleasure of pondering at.

title: Restaurante La Isabela
summary: Michelin star restauran, has a selection of butter and bread that is unbelievably good. Would definitely come back here, even for just a glass of wine.

title: Tom's Steakhouse
address: Carrer Sant Ramon de Penyafort, 9, 17320 Tossa de Mar, Girona
summary: If you like meat, then this steakhouse is perfect after a long session of paddle boarding.

title: Bar del Far de Tossa
address: Carrer del Far, 14, 17320 Tossa de Mar, Girona
summary: Stop for a drink and a snack at this bar, has a really nice terraza, a great place to watch the sunset.

title: Walk along Passeig Maritim
summary: Really scenic and tranquil walk along the wide sidewalk and pausing on a bench to enjoy the view. Perfect to help your lunch go down!

title: El Tambucho for Lunch
address: 08870, Carrer de Port Alegre, 49, 08870 Sitges, Barcelona
summary: Enjoyed a nice glass of spanish wine and some more lovely lunch treats whilst sitting on the terrace and people watching. I could have stayed there all day. I recommend the octupus, very tasty and reasonably priced.

title: Restaurant La Rive for Dinner
summary: Show-stopping French & Mediterranean dishes served in an upscale riverside hotel restaurant. Reservation recommended.

title: De Hallen Amsterdam
summary: Shopping mall with an inhouse theatre, and several bars and restaurants.

itinerary_title: Paris without wine is not fine.
title: Benoit Paris
summary: Classic French Bistro, with fantastic wine and a mouth wateringly good a la carte menu. A worthy adversary to a full stomach.

title: L'Archetto
summary: Simple, tucked-away spaghetti house & pizzeria with rustic exposed beams & an alleyway terrace.

title: Assaje Restaurant
address: Via Ulisse Aldrovandi, 15, 00197 Roma RM, Italy
summary: Phenomenal wine and a delightful outdoor seating area. Watching Rome bustle away with life, while I sit with a glass of wine and watch, is both surreal and .

title: Casa Vicens
summary: Another interesting early work, particularly notable for the influence of Islamic motifs in the design of its facade.

title: Monistrol de Montserrat Train Station
summary: Well done, now you can relax on the train journey home and reminisce over one of Catalunya's most religious pilgrimages'.

title: Orsom Sunset Catamaran with Live Jazz
address: Moll de Drassanes, Portal de la Pau, s/n, 08039 Barcelona
summary: Get there early for a good spot.

title: Keith Harings Mural
address: Outside Macba Plaça dels Àngels, 1, 08001 Barcelona
summary: One of the great public artistic treasures of Barcelona, ​​a linear mural intensely red on a concrete wall near the entrance of the MACBA in El Raval. The long horizontal piece represents a horror story of drugs, diseases and deaths attacked by various humanoid forms of the Haring type. Todos juntos podemos parar el sida (Together we can stop AIDS).

title: Cocktail at the Old Fashioned Gin Tonic & Cocktail Bar
summary: Amaaazing cocktails! Cute barmen in bowties and a reallly small but intimate venue. One cocktail comes in a gumball machine!

title: Como en Casa
summary: 1 Beer, 1 Pincho

title: Bar Marsella
summary: Finish your day at the Bar Marsella, which has been in business since 1820, and has served the likes of Hemingway, who was known to slump here over an absenta (absinthe). The bar still specialises in absinthe, a drink to be treated with respect!

title: Skybar
summary: Pretty pool, great for photos

title: Bus Journey to Barcelona
address: Estació d'Autobusos de Tossa de Mar 17320 Tossa de Mar, Girona

title: Paddle Boarding
summary: I had so much fun stand up paddle boarding, perfect end to the day!

title: Shopping
address: Carrer de les Parellades, 08870 Sitges, Barcelona
summary: I loved walking down this long pedestrianised street, looking in all the shops. I bought some lovely gifts as souvenirs for my kids, but I could have spent more!

title: Mercat Abaceria
summary: Stop by this untouristy market in Gracia on your way to the final stop to pick up a picnic dinner. Grab some good bread, serrano ham, various cheeses, and other alimentos and head up to Parc Guell!

title: 3 Michelin star Lasarte Restaurant -15 course set menu from Paolo Casagrande.
summary: Great drinks

title: La Carboneria
summary: The building was a social center of illegal occupation from 2008 to February 2014, when the squatters were evicted by the police. The Carbonería was saved from destruction by the city council. On November 27, 2015, the building was reclassified as of historical and artistic interest.

title: Restaurant Hoffman
address: Carrer de la Granada del Penedès, 14, 08006 Barcelona
summary: NOOOMMM, great wine list, amazing tapas, never seen the patatas bravas done the way they do it. Absolutely delish!

title: Zodiaco
summary: 1 Beer, 1 Pincho

title: The Serras
summary: Pretty cocktails, had a really nice one with gin and it had edible flowers on top.

title: Beso Sitges
summary: Finish the day off with a yummy paella and nice glass of red wine.

title: O Sorbet d'Amour Sitges
address: Carrer de les Parellades, 49, 08870 Sitges, Barcelona
summary: Very yummy macaroons

title: Park Guell
summary: End the perfect Gaudi day at this magical fantasia. Be transported to a dreamland of radiant mosaics, iridescent fountains, and impossible symmetries. After exploring the park, hike up the hill with your picnic and watch the sun descend on this glorious city of light and magic.

title: El Gato de Botero
summary: The Cat by Fernando Botero was bought by the Barcelona City Council in 1987. From then until 2003, the cat wandered the streets of the city in search of a permanent site. His first stop was the Parc de la Ciutadella, near his fellow animals at the Barcelona Zoo. He was then taken to a site by the Olympic Stadium, and a few years later he was placed in a small square behind the medieval shipyards of Barcelona. Finally, in 2003, the decision was made to move it to a permanent place at the end of the newly created Rambla del Raval.

title: tiela i llibertat
summary: 1 Beer, 1 Pincho
My favourite terrazza above the History Museum of Catalunya, one of the nicest views, can see the docks and the W building.

title: The corner of C/Sant Pau and C/ de la Riereta
address: Carrer de la Riereta & Carrer de Sant Pau08001 Barcelona
summary: Perhaps one of the most emblematic pieces of urban art in Barcelona, ​​the large mural on the corner of Carrer de Sant Pau and Carrer de la Riereta is a tribute to the famous Catalan artist Joan Miró.

title: El Patán
summary: ! Beer, 1 Pincho (One's with the croquettes are delicious)

title: El Pachuco
summary: At reasonable prices, excellent cocktails, best nachos in the city. It's a super small place, so be prepared to wait for a table.

title: Boca Oreja
summary: 1 Beer, 1 Pincho

title: Jardins de Walter Benjamin
summary: Another street art sanctuary located in Jardins de Walter Benjamin. Enjoy the peaceful green gardens and authentic art that extends throughout the park.

title: La Tiza BCN
summary: 1 Beer, 1 Pincho
